definition: to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]

sentences.english: The court did him for robbery.
He was charged with four robberies.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控犯有四起搶劫罪。

sentences.english: The two men were charged with robbery.
sentences.chinese: 那兩個人被指控犯了搶劫罪。

sentences.english: He spent ten years behind bars after being convicted for armed robbery.
sentences.chinese: 在被判持械搶劫罪後，他度過了十年牢獄生活。

sentences.english: The seizing crime is between robbery and steal.
sentences.chinese: 搶奪罪是介於搶劫罪與盜竊罪之間的一種罪。

sentences.english: The crime of robbery is based on violence.
sentences.chinese: 搶劫罪是建立在暴力的基礎上的。

sentences.english: A suspect was convicted of robbery.
sentences.chinese: 一名疑犯被宣判犯了搶劫罪。

sentences.english: In another words, the"commence"of the robbery has to be the behavior of violation on the rights of laws.
sentences.chinese: 即搶劫罪中的着手必須是具有法益侵害現實性的行爲。

sentences.english: The transformation robbery is more than one kind of sending specially robs the crime.
sentences.chinese: 轉化型搶劫罪是一種多發性的特殊搶劫犯罪。

sentences.english: He has been charged with robbery.
sentences.chinese: 他已被指控犯了搶劫罪。

definition: to bring to justice/to hand over to the law
to raise a charge/to sue/to institute proceedings
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
